title: To Be a Great Engineering Manager, Be Boring
description: To be a great software engineering manager and leader, you should strive to build a BORING organization, one that never requires heroism. Predictability is more important than velocity.

title: The 3.5 Things to Consider When Picking Technologies | Engineering Leadership
description: If you're a software engineering leader, you're gonna have to make technology choices. Here are 3 key things to consider and 1 pro-tip for guidance.

title: Should an engineering manager still write code?
description: This is an age-old question bordering on the religious. In my opinion, it's not a matter of "should" or team size.

title: #FOCUS | Steal This Team Alignment Practice
description:
If you're part of your organization's leadership team, it can be tough to keep abreast of everything happening within your org. I've been there. 

As we grew, my software engineering team used this practice to 1.) keep a finger on the pulse of development and 2.) keep teams across the breadth of the organization aligned.

Steal it!

title: Run Better Standups | Engineering Leadership
description: I don't love traditional, by-the-book standup meetings. Here's how I run them instead. Give it a go?

title: Software Development Project Planning Tips | Engineering Management
description: Are you an Engineering Manager who struggles with your dev team's project planning? Here are some quick thoughts on how to get better.

title: 3 Key Dev Team Metrics | Engineering Leadership
description: Wondering what are the best metrics to track for your engineering team? Don't get bogged down by tracking too many. Make sure the ones you track tell a story about the actual effectiveness of your team. These were the THREE KEY metrics I tracked for our team of ~300 software engineers.
